document.masterDocTitle: A revision of the Bracon Fabricius species in Wesmael’s collection deposited in Brussels (Hymenoptera: Braconidae: Braconinae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A revision of the Bracon Fabricius species in Wesmael’s collection deposited in Brussels (Hymenoptera: Braconidae: Braconinae)

bibRefCitation.author: Wesmael C.
bibRefCitation.refString: Wesmael C. 1838. Monographie des Braconides de Belgique. Nouveaux Memoires de l'Academie royale des Sciences Bruxelles 11: 1 - 166.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Braco megapterus
Wesmael, 1838: 22
♀ (type material: 5 ♀♀ , seen 4 ♀♀ ), type locality: “...environs de Charleroi et de Bruxelles ” ( Belgium ), ♀ lectotype (and three ♀ paralectotypes , present designations) in the Royal Belgian Institute of Natural Sciences, Brussels ; examined.

(in key), 295 (description) (in Russian) and 378 (in key), 402 (description) (in German) ♀ ( type material:? ♀ ), type locality: “Europäischer Teil der UdSSR, ehem. Gouv. Ufa,”.

– Tobias 1961 (in subgenus

(as valid species, literature up to 1961).

heading.emphasis:
Designation of the ♀ lectotype of
Bracon megapterus

subSubSection.paragraph: (first label, printed) “Coll. Wesmael”, (second label, printed) “2047”, (third label, partly handwritten) “ Braco ♀ / megapterus mihi / dét. C. Wesmael”, (fourth label, printed red) “Type”, fifth label is the lectotype card. - Lectotype is in good condition: (1) micropinned, (2) left flagellum missing, right flagellum apically deficient.

heading.emphasis:
Designation of the three ♀ paralectotypes of
Bracon megapterus
( 1 ♀ : “var. 1.”)

subSubSection.paragraph: Labels identical to those of the lectotype except paralectotype cards. Paralectotype are in good condition: (1) micropinned, (2) one ♀ with deficient flagellum, left hind wing glued separately, (3) one ♀ with missing both flagelli and left fore leg (except coxa + trochanter), (4) one ♀ with missing head and left fore leg (except coxa).

11 ♀♀ + 3 ♁♁ from seven countries: GERMANY : 2 ♀♀ + 1 ♁ from three localities. BOHEMIA : 3 ♀♀ + 1 ♁ from two localities. POLAND : 1 ♀ . SLOVAKIA : 1 ♀ . CROATIA : 1 ♀ : EUROPEAN RUSSIA : 1 ♀ + 1 ♁ from two localties. MONGOLIA : 2 ♀♀ from one locality.

heading.emphasis:
Redescription of the ♀ lectotype of
Bracon megapterus
( Fig. 22 A-I)

subSubSection.paragraph: ANTENNAE. Right antenna apically deficient and with 39 antennomeres (according to the original description “de 39 on 40 articles environ”). First flagellomere 1.4 times as long as broad, further flagellomeres gradually shortening so that 37th flagellomere subcubic, i.e. just longer than broad.

WINGS. Forewing as long as body. Pterostigma ( Fig. 22F ) 2.6 times as long as wide and issuing
r somewhat
proximally from its middle,
r short
, 0.45 times as long as width of pterostigma; second submarginal cell long, 3-SR 1.75 times as long as 2-SR , SR1 straight, reaching tip of wing and 1.4 times as long as 3-SR ; 1-R1 distinctly 1.6 times as long as pterostigma. First discal cell subquadrate, 1-M 1.5 times as long as m-cu , 1-SR-M 1.2 times longer than 1-M ( Fig. 22G ).

caption.paragraph:
Fig. 22.
Bracon ( Foveobracon ) megapterus Wesmael, 1838
(A-I: ♀ lectotype, J-L: ♀). A . Head in dorsal view. B . Head in frontal view. C . Propodeum. D . Hind femur. E . Claw. F . Distal part of right forewing. G . First discal cell of right forewing. H . Tergites 1-3. I . Hind end of ovipositor apparatus. J . Second tergite. K . Hind femur. L . First discal cell of right forewing.

subSubSection.paragraph: COLOUR. Antenna, head, mesosoma and first tergite black. Eyes with interrupted reddish yellow pattern. Mandible reddish yellow. Palpi proximo-distally black to brown. Coxae + trochanters black, rest of legs blackish brown, fore femur with yellowish pattern. Metasoma (except black first tergite) yellow, areola of second tergite blackish brown. Ovipositor sheath black. Wings dark brownish fumous, pterostigma and veins brown.

paragraph.emphasis: Redescription of the three ♀ paralectotypes of

subSubSection.paragraph: Similar to the lectotype . Eye in dorsal view 1.5 times as long as temple ( 1 ♀ ). Tergites 3-6 medially with faint brownish maculae.

heading.emphasis: Variable features of the ♀ ( 5 ♀♀ ) ( Fig. 22 J-L)

subSubSection.paragraph: Areola of second tergite laterally more impressed and here with strong crenulo-rugosity, lateral pair of impressions well distinct ( Fig. 22J ). Hind femur 3.6-3.8 times as long as broad medially ( Fig. 22K ). Forewing: 3-SR 1.7-1.8 times as long as 2-SR ; first discal cell less subquadrate, 1-M twice as long as m-cu ( Fig. 22L ).

caption.paragraph:
Fig. 23. — A .
Bracon ( Foveobracon ) megapterus Wesmael, 1838
, ♀, middle part of forewing: pterostigma and second submarginal cell. — B-D .
Bracon ( Foveobracon ) plugarui Tobias, 1986
, ♀. B . Head in dorsal view. C . Distal part of right forewing. D . Tergites 1-2. — E-F .
Bracon ( Foveobracon ) roberti Wesmael, 1838
, ♁. E . Head in dorsal view. F . First tergite. — G-H .
Bracon ( Glabrobracon ) orbus Papp, 1981
, ♀ holotype. G . Head in dorsal view. H . tergites 1-3.

subSubSection.paragraph:
COL. Cerambycidae :
Molorchus umbellatarum Schreber.
— LEP. Thyatiridae :
Achlya flavicornis Linnaeus
,
Polyploca ridens Fabricius.
Belgium , France , Germany , Bohemia , Slovakia , Slovenia , Croatia , Bulgaria , Finland , European Russia , Mongolia . A less frequent to sporadic species.

Within the subgenus
Foveobracon
the species
B. ( Fo. ) megapterus
is nearest to
B. ( Fo. ) plugarui Tobias
considering their antero-median areola on second tergite and colour of the body; the two species are separated by a few features:

1 (2) Temple in dorsal view rounded ( Fig. 22A ). Second submarginal cell long, 3-SR 1.7-1.8 times as long as 2-SR,
r shorter
than widht of pterostigma ( Fig. 22F ). Second tergite along areola crenulate ( Fig. 22H, J ). Antenna with 35-37 antennomeres. Femora 2-3 black. Body strongly built. ♀ ♁: 5 mm .......................................................................................................
B. ( Fo. ) megapterus Wesmael, 1838

2 (1) Temple in dorsal view receded ( Fig. 23B ). Second submarginal cell less long, 3-SR 1.2-1.3 times as long as 2-SR ,
r longer
than width of pterostigma ( Fig. 23C ). Second tergite around areola rugorugulose ( Fig. 23D ). Antenna with 26-27 antennomeres. Femora 2-3 yellow. Body usually built. ♀ ♁: 2 mm .....................................................................................................
B. ( Fo. ) plugarui Tobias, 1986
